title: How to open INBOX file
content:
Hi

I am having trouble finding emails with malicious attachments. I'm using one of ESET's security products which, after scans, find malicious content in the INBOX file, located locally on the device under the path %APPDATA%%RoamingThunderbirdProfiles(_Name_Of_the_profile)_Imapmail(_Name_of_mail)_INBOX(mail123). Unfortunately, the security product is unable to get rid of the dangerous file, but only gives information that something bad is in the email. When trying to find a specific email, I unfortunately run into a lot of problems. 1. the name of the email - in this case "mail123" does not exist in the thunderbird application itself. If I understand correctly, thunderbird itself chooses names for individual mails and then packs them in the INBOX file. 2. it is possible to correlate the email name from the INBOX file to the actual name(subject) of the email using other software such as MailStoreHome by importing the entire email profile (_Name_of_the_profile). 3. once the email is already correlated and found in MailStoreHome, I should be able to find the same email in Thunderbird (as I have imported the INBOX file, which is located locally, and which Thunderbird itself reads). Well, unfortunately no. Such an email in the Thunderbird mailbox (I already know the subject, content, date, etc.) does not exist.

And here comes my question. Is it possible to open the INBOX file itself and then find the unfortunate email and delete it?
creator: Zdenon

title: ActivX/COM probleem
content:
Goedemorgen,

Af en toe gebruik ik CCleaner om het register van mijn computer te scannen op problemen. Meestal krijg ik dan de volgende waarschuwing te zien: ActiveX/COM-probleem InProcServer32\C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Thunderbird\notificationserver.dll

Nadat CCleaner het probleem heeft opgelost, verschijnt bij een volgende scan toch weer dezelfde waarschuwing.

CCleaner beschouwt ActivX/COM blijkbaar als een veiligheidsprobleem. Dus vraag ik mij af waarom ActivX/COM wordt gebruikt in Mozilla Thunderbird.

Ik ben benieuwd naar uw reactie.

Met vriendelijke groet,

Leo Steijn leo.steijn@ziggo.nl
creator: leo.steijn

title: Incoming emails
content:
My thunderbird has stopped receiving emails on my PC ( none sine 20 Jun 2024) I don't check the desktop PC every day as I normally use my phone for managing incoming and outgoing emails As a secondary use, I sometimes use my Laptop to Manage incoming and outgoing emails. Both the phone and the laptop are up to date with incoming emails. I can send an email to myself from the PC. Mozilla Thunderbird is up to date with auto update program.

Can someone please advise what steps I need to take to find out why this has just occurred. I am wondering if a recent auto update to Thunderbird has caused this issue . I am not ware if one can rollback to a previous Thunderbird revision to check if this is the cause? Any assistance will be greatly appreciated.

Thanks Greg
creator: gregblake

title: Impossibile scrivere il messaggio nella cartella di posta
content: PC Windows 11. Da ieri sera, un account che uso con Thunderbird cerca continuamente di scaricare email vecchie in entrata (a partire dal 28 giugno) anziché solo le nuove e ad un certo punto mi presenta il messaggio "Impossibile scrivere il messaggio nella cartella di posta. Controllare di possedere i permessi di scrittura nel file system e di avere spazio sufficiente per copiare la cartella di posta." Il numero di email scaricate varia di volta in volta, ma nel fare questo ad un certo punto si blocca e mi dà quel messaggio. Preciso che ho già provato tutte le cose che si suggerisce di fare per questo problema (antivirus, verifica dimensioni massime cartella, autorità di scrivere sulla cartella, riparare inbox, eliminare e far ricreare file msf, ecc.). Gli altri account che gestisco con la stessa installazione di Thunderbird funzionano. Lo stesso account è accessibile correttamente e sempre con Thunderbird da un altro PC. Ho provato a eliminare l'account e ricrearlo: non risolve. Ho provato a eliminare l'account e modificare un altro account funzionante per trasformarlo in quello che non va. Fatto ciò, anche quello mi ripresenta l'identico problema. Non so più cosa fare, perché ogni cosa che faccio fa pensare che il problema non sia lì. Per me questo è un problema grave perché è un indirizzo email di lavoro e il PC che mi dà problema è quello che uso per lavorare.
creator: dario13

title: Have thunderbird reindex mailboxes instead of compacting
content:
I'm running Thunderbird 115.12.0 64-bit on Ubuntu 22.04. I recently had a hard drive crash. I've had to put together my email data from two separate backups to restore everything. The problem is I reorganized the mailbox folders between the backups, so the metadata thunderbird maintains about the data storage will be wrong in my new setup. I have my imap and pop mailboxes restored correctly now under my profile storage and would like Thunderbird to just leave them alone. The problem is, every time I start thunderbird, it automatically wants to compact my mailboxes and free up 5.7 GB of space, which means it will delete some of the newly copied emails it doesn't recognize.

Is there a way to tell thunderbird to start over and reindex the mailboxes that are there? I've tried deleting the global-messages-db.sqlite file, but that does not fix the problem. This is a common problem as I've had it happen in the past as well when reorganizing the folder structure. It seems there should be a way to tell thunderbird to reset its indexes and leave the mailboxes as-is.

Any help would be appreciated.
creator: wgadsby

creator: oxenber

title: reply option without opening an email
content:
How do I reply to an email when i have selected it in the inbox and I can read the email in the preview window? As far as I can tell there is no reply button anywhere. I did double click on the message and suddenly about 30 tabs opened up with each tab having a reply button, which is very nice if I wanted to answer all 30 replies individually. Now I have to open every email to reply and close 20-60 tabs just to reply, which I won't put up with just because of the nuisance bur for sure because of arthritis.

Note: Someone recommended thunderbird to me as very useful but without a reply button in the inbox this is not really a usefull email program. This seems like a minimum common sense basic email function. If you are going to force people to double click on an email in order to reply, it would common sense to only open up that email and not all 30-60 other emails in the string as one will want to reply to the latest email and not to all other emails in the string. If people want to open up all the emails (I can't think that are very many people that want that), make that option a triple click. Right now I have to do an extra click for a reply (compared to any other email software I have ever used) and I have to close 20-60 tabs just to reply to the latest email message, this makes thunderbird a waste of time. I can't imagine I am the only one that considers these two issues basic common sense in email software. Maybe most people just delete thunderbird as I was planning on doing without commenting.
creator: jkbenthem

title: Thunderbird op mijn desktop bevat helemaal geen gegevens meer
content: Ik heb naast mijn desktop ook nog een laptop. Deze laatste sloeg enkele dagen geleden de verzonden mails niet meer op en bleef maar "zoeken". Ik heb dat gemeld en gisteren was het probleem helemaal hersteld en de laptop werkt weer perfect. Maar toen ik de desktop opstartte en wilde mailen, stootte ik alleen op een bedankje voor een eenmalige betaling en vond ik verder alles leeg. Geen enkel mailtje meer, geen adresboek enz. Dit is blijkbaar synchroon met het herstel van de laptop gebeurd. Ik kan nu alleen nog alle gegevens invullen voor Thunderbird met het oude mailadres, maar ik ben bang dat dan ook de gegevens die er wel nog op de laptop zijn ook nog kwijt raak.Hoe kan ik in ieder geval een backup van Thunderbird op de laptop maken? Hopelijk kunt u mij helpen.
creator: Nassara

title: options for filtering dates in Find Events are pretty limited
content: Yesterday I migrated Thunderbird from Supernova to Nebula. Using the Find Events button in Calendar, I used to see, by default, all events matching the search criteria (text, tags, read/unread etc.). In Nebula, the options for filtering the dates are very limited (see attached image). For example, I would like to be able to select the previous month (for expense claims) or the current of previous calendar year (for fiscal data) or the year to date. Or maybe a custom date range. Or, like in Supernova, everything. I never noticed any performance issue, so please bring back the Supernova default or at least provide some extra options.
